questions.question_text:
A customer is developing a new eCommerce section of their website and plans to leverage transactional data in customer journeys.
Which two Marketing Cloud features will support this effort? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: I think Content Builder is ok, as you need to add the transactional data in the emails
If Contact Builder is the right wording, shouldn't the answer be Contact Builder and Data Designer?
Agreed it should be Contact Builder, not Content Builder.
Should "content builder" be Audience builder or Contact builder, as that is where the data model is built and transactional data extensions can be linked to contacts
Unless it's a single step, single send, API triggered journey I think it should be set to 're-entry at any time' to accommodate multi-purchase behavior.
Why not D? What about situations where they purchase two products in two separate orders?

Definitely is D, documentation says so:
Select Re-entry at any time if contacts can enter the journey multiple times before exiting. This setting admits the contact into the journey each time that contact meets filter criteria. For example, if you use a journey for a post-purchase engagement, you can allow contacts to enter the journey whenever they make a purchase.

Reference: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_jb_journey_settings.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: D
Answer is definitely D.

Selected Answer: D
Re-entry anytime allows the contact to enter the journey multiple times simultaneously. For example, if you use a journey for a post-purchase engagement, you can allow contacts to enter the journey whenever they make a purchase.
